value.title: Trump downplays impact of massive hacking, questions Russia involvement
value.excerpt: U.S. President Donald Trump, in his first comments about a widespread data breach across the U.S. government, on Saturday downplayed the cyber espionage campaign and questioned whether Russia was to blame as alleged by his own top diplomat.

value.title: Trump Contradicts Pompeo Over Russia’s Role in Hack
value.excerpt: Hours after the secretary of state acknowledged that Moscow was behind the vast cybersecurity breach, the president suggested it might have been China and downplayed the severity of the attack.

value.title: Former US cybersecurity chief Chris Krebs warned not to 'conflate' voting system security with the SolarWinds hack despite Trump's claim
value.excerpt: Chris Krebs' warning came after President Donald Trump tweeted there could have been a hit on "our ridiculous voting machines during the election."

value.title: Trump wanted conspiracy theorist Sidney Powell as special counsel on voter fraud – report
value.excerpt: Rudy Giuliani and other advisers opposed president’s suggestion, according to New York Times

value.title: With Trump Fading, Ukraine’s President Looks to a Reset With the U.S.
value.excerpt: They roped us in, but I think we behaved with dignity,” Volodymyr Zelensky said of his encounter with American politics.

value.title: Biggest vets groups step up pressure on Trump to fire Wilkie
value.excerpt: The nation’s six largest veterans groups are calling on President Donald Trump to immediately fire Veterans Affairs Secretary Robert Wilkie over the mishandling of a congressional aide’s allegation of

value.title: Donald and Melania Trump wear matching tuxedos in their final White House Christmas picture
value.excerpt: The picture shows the Trumps smiling as they stand together on the Grand staircase in the White House, beneath festive Christmas decorations.

value.title: EXCLUSIVE: Lawmakers ask FBI and Federal Election Commission to investigate Jared Kushner-backed Trump campaign company after Insider's reporting
value.excerpt: In a letter obtained by Insider, two lawmakers told the FBI and the FEC that the only way to know if the Trump campaign violated federal laws is for the agencies to open an investigation.

value.title: High Court Rejects as Premature a Bid to Block Trump Plan to Bar Illegal Immigrants in Redistricting
value.excerpt: By 6-3 vote, the high court’s conservatives say the case is premature until it is clear that the outgoing administration could implement the policy.

value.title: Abortion, Guns and Trump: A Church Group Tries to Navigate America’s Divisions
value.excerpt: In suburban Michigan, a group of worshipers from Calvary Christian Reformed Church sought understanding through dialogue. Sometimes it was tough going. ‘My soul is hurting,’ one member lamented.

value.title: Atlantic City auctions off chance to push demolish button on former Trump casino
value.excerpt: The implosion of one of President Donald Trump's former Atlantic City casinos is being delayed by a few weeks.

value.title: Trump has discussed rebooting 'The Apprentice' as he prepares to leave the White House, according to a report
value.excerpt: The president has reportedly talked to aides about the prospect of reviving the reality TV show in which he starred.

value.title: White House aides talked Trump out of last-minute demand for stimulus checks as big as $2,000
value.excerpt: Advisers persuaded the president on Thursday not to announce support for significantly bigger stimulus payments.

value.title: Late Night Compares Trump Health Adviser, Paul Alexander, to a Comic Book Villain
value.excerpt: The former Health and Human Services adviser’s leaked emails encouraged herd immunity to deal with the pandemic, writing of Americans, “We want them infected.”

value.title: Turning Point USA: Will A-list conservative speakers admit Trump lost?
value.excerpt: Will speakers like Rudy Giuliani, Donald Trump Jr., Tucker Carlson and Laura Ingraham admit Trump lost when they speak at Turning Point USA?

value.title: Seth Meyers: Trump's 'going to be our first nomad ex-president'
value.excerpt: Late-night hosts discuss a request by residents of Palm Beach, Florida, to keep Trump from residing in Mar-a-Lago and belated GOP admissions of Biden’s victory

value.title: What comes next for a Donald Trump impersonator? J-L Cauvin has thoughts
value.excerpt: J-L Cauvin, a full-time lawyer who became a social media sensation as an impersonator, has plans for comedy after the Donald leaves the White House.

value.title: U.N. Security Council to talk Western Sahara after Trump policy switch
value.excerpt: The U.N. Security Council is planning to discuss Western Sahara on Monday, diplomats said, after U.S. President Donald Trump recognized Morocco's sovereignty over the disputed region in return for the kingdom normalizing ties with Israel.

value.title: Rules eased for water from showerheads, a Trump pet peeve
value.excerpt: The Trump administration has relaxed a regulation restricting water flow from showerheads — something that was a pet peeve of President Donald Trump, who complained that he wanted more water to make his hair “perfect.

value.title: Campaign 2016 updates: Donald Trump says women accusing him of sexual misconduct ‘will be sued after the election is over’
value.excerpt: Donald Trump hits the campaign trail in Gettysburg, Pa., while Hillary Clinton is in Philadelphia. Trump says women accusing him of sexual assault will be sued after the electionAn adult film actress becomes Trump's latest accuser Khizr Khan,

value.title: Trump administration cuts $200M in health care funds to California over abortion regulations
value.excerpt: The office of California Gov. Gavin Newsom criticized the Department of Health and Human Services' move as an ploy “to score cheap political points."

value.title: Cardinal Pell on Trump, Benedict XVI and a plot against him
value.excerpt: Pope Francis’ former treasurer, Cardinal George Pell, has praised President Donald Trump’s “splendid” Supreme Court appointments and defense of Christian values

value.title: North Carolina GOP lawmaker urges Trump to suspend civil liberties to keep power: ‘Invoke the Insurrection Act’
value.excerpt: Republican North Carolina state Sen. Bob Steinburg said President Trump should declare a national emergency, suspend civil rights, and remain in power over his baseless claims of electoral fraud.

value.title: Trump names USPS board nominee, potentially solidifying GOP control of mail service
value.excerpt: Roy A. Bernardi, a former HUD official, would become the fifth Republican on the nine-member board of governors if he wins Senate confirmation.

value.title: ‘Like a hand grasping’: Trump appointees describe the crushing of the CDC
value.excerpt: Kyle McGowan, a former chief of staff at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, and his deputy, Amanda Campbell, were installed in 2018 as two of the youngest political appointees in the history of the world’s premier public health agency,

value.title: How far did Ron DeSantis’s loyalty to Trump go?
value.excerpt: When Ron DeSantis ran for governor of Florida in 2018, he made a politically savvy decision: He would be the most pro-President-Trump candidate possible. He popped up on Fox News repeatedly, understanding that it would be an effective way to get Trump’s attention.

value.title: Trump lashes out at McConnell for recognizing Biden’s victory: ‘People are angry!’
value.excerpt: President Trump pleaded with Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell to continue supporting his efforts to undermine the election after McConnell acknowledged President-elect Joe Biden's win in the electoral college.

value.title: ‘Like a Hand Grasping’: Trump Appointees Describe the Crushing of the C.D.C.
value.excerpt: Kyle McGowan, a former chief of staff at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, and his deputy, Amanda Campbell, go public on the Trump administration’s manipulation of the agency.

value.title: Iran's Rouhani says he is happy that 'lawless' Trump is leaving office
value.excerpt: Iranian President Hassan Rouhani said on Wednesday he was happy that Donald Trump was leaving office, calling him "the most lawless U.S. president" and a "terrorist".

value.title: Some advisers urge Trump not to veto defense bill: source
value.excerpt: U.S. President Donald Trump is being urged by some advisers not to go ahead with his plan to veto a major defense bill because it is all but certain to be overridden by the U.S. Congress, a source familiar with the situation said on Tuesday.
